name: Harissa
description: A thick porridge made from khorasan wheat (similar to wheat berries) and chicken, traditionally cooked slowly to a creamy consistency, often served with melted butter and cinnamon.
steps: Cook chicken in water with salt until tender and the meat falls off the bones.
Remove the chicken, debone, and shred the meat.
Add washed khorasan wheat to the chicken broth and cook until the wheat is soft and begins to break down.
Add the shredded chicken back to the pot, continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture becomes porridge-like.
Serve hot, topped with melted butter and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
tips: Stir the harissa frequently as it cooks to prevent sticking and to help achieve a smooth texture.
Cooking time may vary depending on the type of wheat; patience is key.
Harissa can be made in large batches and refrigerated or frozen for later use.
